summary: Thalassemia is a genetic blood disorder affecting hemoglobin production.
It often causes anemia and can lead to organ enlargement.
Severity varies with specific gene mutations.
Sickle cell anemia causes red blood cells to become sickle-shaped.
It leads to pain crises and increased infection risk.
Lifelong management and specialist care are usually required.
Asthma affects the airways and causes breathing difficulties.
Triggers include allergens, cold air, and exercise.
Treatment includes inhalers and avoiding triggers.
Symptoms are non-specific; seek clinical evaluation for diagnosis.
